elements.name: furo-config-loader
elements.description:
`furo-config-loader` loads a configuration json in to the defined section.

To access the config values, use `furo-config`.

```html
<furo-config-loader
    src="/custom/view-config.json"
    section="views"
    ></furo-config-loader>
```

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: File source

attributes.name: section
attributes.description: Targeted section to load the config in.

properties.name: src
properties.description: File source

properties.name: section
properties.description: Targeted section to load the config in.

events.name: config-loaded
events.description: Fired when the config is loaded with the loaded config as detail.

elements.name: furo-config
elements.description:
`furo-config`

 Access config data


```html
<!-- set with config-loader -->
<furo-config-loader
    section="views"
    src="/viewconfig.json"
    ></furo-config>


<!-- consume a config -->
<furo-config
    section="views" at-config-updated="--conf"
    ></furo-config>

<!-- consume a sub path of a config section -->
<furo-config
    section="views.subset.deep" at-config-updated="--deepconf"
    ></furo-config>
```

attributes.name: section
attributes.description:
section of the config object that you are interested in

access deep object with dots like `main.sub.sub`

properties.name: section
properties.description:
section of the config object that you are interested in

access deep object with dots like `main.sub.sub`

properties.name: config
properties.description: The current section of the config, which was defined by `section`.

events.name: config-updated
events.description: Fired when section changed

elements.name: furo-de-bounce
elements.description:
The Debounce technique allow us to “group” multiple sequential calls in a single one.

[Read more about debouncing here](https://css-tricks.com/debouncing-throttling-explained-examples/)



```html
<furo-de-bounce
    fn-trigger="--searchStringEntered" at-debounced="--debouncedSrch"
    ></furo-de-bounce>
```

attributes.name: wait
attributes.description:
Debounce time in milliseconds
Default value: 250

attributes.name: immediate
attributes.description:
If true, input-wire is triggered immediatley (leading edge instead of trailing)
Default value: false

properties.name: immediate
properties.description:
If true, input-wire is triggered immediatley (leading edge instead of trailing)
Default value: false

properties.name: wait
properties.description:
Debounce time in milliseconds
Default value: 250

methods.name: trigger
methods.description: Trigger the debounce

events.name: out
events.description: deprecated, use debounced instead. // TODO: remove @out and fn-input-wire in q2 2022

events.name: debounced
events.description: Fired after N milliseconds. If `immediate`is set to TRUE, it fires on the leading edge.

elements.name: furo-feature-toggle
elements.description:
`furo-feature-toggle`
 Is a handler for feature toggles, you can react to key changes with FBP.
 This component is quite simple, but gives you a lot of possibilities.
 Read more about feature toggles in the [guide](/docs/guides/featuretoggle/)

 ```html
 <!-- setting a key -->
<furo-feature-toggle
    key="feature.easter.egg" fn-set-true="--activateClicked" fn-set-false="--disableClicked">
    </furo-feature-toggle>

 <!-- observing key changes -->
 <furo-feature-toggle
    key="feature.xxxx.yyy"  at-key-activated="--fxyActivated" at-key-changed="--fxyChanged">
    </furo-feature-toggle>

 ```

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: Name of a feature toggle.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Name of a feature toggle.

methods.name: set-false
methods.description: Sets a feature key state to false.

methods.name: set-true
methods.description: Sets a feature key state to true.

events.name: key-true
events.description: Fired when the key is set to true or is true on init.

events.name: key-false
events.description: Fired when the key is set to false or is false on init.

events.name: key-changed
events.description: Fired on init and when the key changes its state.

elements.name: furo-fetch-json
elements.description:
`furo-fetch-json`
 Fetches and parses json data from a source.

 ```html
 <furo-fetch-json src="/example.json" fn-fetch="|--FBPready" at-data="--contentReceived"></furo-fetch-json>
 ```

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: the url you want to fetch

properties.name: src
properties.description: the url you want to fetch

methods.name: fetch
methods.description:
fetch and parse the data from specified `src`.

Use fetch-src if you want to pass the source url

methods.name: fetch-src
methods.description: fetch json data from source

events.name: data
events.description: Fired when data received and json parsed

events.name: parse-error
events.description: Fired when json is not parseable

elements.name: furo-forth-stack
elements.description:
`furo-forth-stack` is a declarative stack, inspired by the forth stack.

https://hackaday.com/2017/01/27/forth-the-hackers-language/
http://wiki.laptop.org/go/Forth_stack_operators
http://galileo.phys.virginia.edu/classes/551.jvn.fall01/primer.htm#stacks

properties.name: size
properties.description: Current size of the stack

methods.name: clear-stack
methods.description: Empties the stack and set the stack-size to 0

methods.name: put
methods.description: Add an element to the stack

methods.name: swap
methods.description:
swap **( n1 n2 -- n2 n1 )**

swap, as you may have guessed, swaps the top two elements of the stack. For example:

1 2 3 4 swap
will give you:

1 2 4 3 <- Top

methods.name: drop
methods.description:
drop **( n -- )**

 drop simply drops the top element of the stack. Running:

 1 2 3 drop
 gives you a stack of:

 1 2 <- Top

methods.name: dup
methods.description:
dup **( n -- n n )**

    dup is short for “duplicate” – it duplicates the top element of the stack. For example, try this out:

    1 2 3 dup

    You should end up with the following stack:

    1 2 3 3 <- Top

methods.name: over
methods.description:
over **( n1 n2 -- n1 n2 n1 )**

   over is a bit less obvious: it takes the second element from the top of the stack and duplicates it to the top of the stack. Running this:

   1 2 3 over
   will result in this:

   1 2 3 2 <- Top

methods.name: rot
methods.description:
rot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n2 n3 n1 )**

   Finally, rot “rotates” the top three elements of the stack. The third element from the top of the stack gets moved to the top of the stack, pushing the other two elements down.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   2 3 1 <- Top

methods.name: rrot
methods.description:
rrot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n3 n1 n2 )**

   Reverse rotation or right rotation rrot “rotates” the elements of the stack inverse to rot.
   The top elemen the stack gets moved to the bottom of the stack.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   3 1 2 <- Top

events.name: stack-size-changed
events.description: Fired when the stack size changes with Integer with the current size of the stack.

events.name: rotated
events.description: Fired when stack was rotated

events.name: stack-changed
events.description: Fired when the stack contents changes after put, drop,...

events.name: swapped
events.description: Fired when stack was swapped

events.name: empty
events.description: Fired when stack gets empty

elements.name: furo-get-clipboard
elements.description:
`furo-get-clipboard`
 get the clipboard content from the OS.

```html

<furo-get-clipboard
    fn-trigger="--clipboardContentRequested" at-content="--contentReceived"
    ></furo-get-clipboard>

```

attributes.name: json
attributes.description: Convert clipboard content to json

properties.name: json
properties.description: Convert clipboard content to json

events.name: content
events.description: Fired when clipboard content is received

elements.name: furo-head-tail
elements.description:
`furo-head-tail`
 Splits an iterable (i.e. Array) in its head and tail part.

```
 <furo-head-tail fn-split="--arrayData" at-head="--firstElement" at-tail="--restOfArray"></furo-head-tail>
```

methods.name: split
methods.description:
Splits an iterable to its head (first item) and its tail (the rest) parts.

```
[ a ,  b ,  c ,  d ]
 |_|  |___________|
  ^      ^
  |      |
  |     TAIL   => [ b ,  c ,  d ]
 HEAD          =>  a 
```

events.name: head
events.description: Fired when Array was splitted, contains the first element of array.

events.name: tail
events.description: Fired when Array was splitted. {Array || Any} is the tail from the injected array (e1 - 1n)

swap, as you may have guessed, swaps the top two elements of the stack. For example:

1 2 3 4 swap
will give you:

1 2 4 3 <- Top

methods.name: rot
methods.description:
rot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n2 n3 n1 )**

   Finally, rot “rotates” the top three elements of the stack. The third element from the top of the stack gets moved to the top of the stack, pushing the other two elements down.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   2 3 1 <- Top

methods.name: roll
methods.description:
rot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n2 n3 n1 )**

   Finally, rot “rotates” the top three elements of the stack. The third element from the top of the stack gets moved to the top of the stack, pushing the other two elements down.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   2 3 1 <- Top

methods.name: over
methods.description:
over **( n1 n2 -- n1 n2 n1 )**

   over is a bit less obvious: it takes the second element from the top of the stack and duplicates it to the top of the stack. Running this:

   will result in this:

   1 2 3 2 <- Top

methods.name: rrot

rrot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n3 n1 n2 )**

elements.name: furo-interval-pulse
elements.description:
`furo-interval-pulse`

Pulses a tick event every `interval` ms duration and every `takt` a tock event is also fired.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: Duration of a tact in ms.

attributes.name: takt
attributes.description: Number of ticks per tact.

attributes.name: auto
attributes.description: Starts interval automatically

properties.name: interval
properties.description: Duration of a tact in ms.

properties.name: takt
properties.description: Number of ticks per tact.

properties.name: auto
properties.description: Starts interval automatically

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts the pulsing.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the pulsing.

events.name: tick
events.description: Fired on every interval with the position of the pulse starting at 0.

events.name: tock
events.description: Fired nth interval defined by takt.

elements.name: furo-key-filter
elements.description:
`furo-key-filter`
Allows only defined keyboard events to pass through

```html
<!-- note the asterisk on other-component keydown. Because filter needs the keyboard event. -->
<other-component at-keydown="--keydown(*)"></other-component>
<furo-key-filter
    fn-filter="--keydown" at-matched="--escapePressed"
    keys="Escape"
    ></furo-key-filter>
```

attributes.name: keys
attributes.description: Coma separated list with allowed keys to pass. i.e "Enter, ArrowUp"

attributes.name: shift
attributes.description: Modifier key **shift** must be pressed too to match

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Modifier key **alt** must be pressed too to match

attributes.name: command
attributes.description:
Alias for meta.

Modifier key **meta** must be pressed too to match.

attributes.name: meta
attributes.description: Modifier key **meta** must be pressed too to match

attributes.name: control
attributes.description: Modifier key **control** must be pressed too to match

properties.name: keys
properties.description: Coma separated list with allowed keys to pass. i.e "Enter, ArrowUp"

properties.name: shift
properties.description: Modifier key **shift** must be pressed too to match

properties.name: alt
properties.description: Modifier key **alt** must be pressed too to match

properties.name: command
properties.description:
Alias for meta.

Modifier key **meta** must be pressed too to match.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: Modifier key **meta** must be pressed too to match

properties.name: control
properties.description: Modifier key **control** must be pressed too to match

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Check the event and dispatch matched when the conditions are fulfilled.

events.name: matched
events.description: Fired when key matches the options

elements.name: furo-keydown
elements.description:
`furo-keydown` attaches a keypress listener to the parent element and gives you handy events to work with.

When you set `alt`, `ctrl` or any of the other arguments, the key event will be triggered only if the corresponding key was pressed too.

 [more about keydown](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/keydown_event)

```html
<furo-keydown key="Enter" at-key="--enterPressed"></furo-keydown>
<furo-keydown ctrl key="c" at-key="--copyRequested"></furo-keydown>
```

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: Key to listen on. Like Enter, Backspace, ArrowLeft, A,B,C, a,b,c

attributes.name: global
attributes.description: Set this attribute to listen to the keydown event global (window).

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: `alt` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

attributes.name: ctrl
attributes.description: `ctrl` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

attributes.name: meta
attributes.description: `meta` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

attributes.name: shift
attributes.description: `shift` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

attributes.name: prevent-default
attributes.description: Set this attribute to prevent the event default of the keypress event.

attributes.name: stop-propagation
attributes.description: Set this to true to stop the event propagation of the keypress event.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Key to listen on. Like Enter, Backspace, ArrowLeft, A,B,C, a,b,c

properties.name: global
properties.description: Set this attribute to listen to the keydown event global (window).

properties.name: alt
properties.description: `alt` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

properties.name: ctrl
properties.description: `ctrl` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

properties.name: meta
properties.description: `meta` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: `shift` key must be pressed to trigger the `key` event.

properties.name: preventDefault
properties.description: Set this attribute to prevent the event default of the keypress event.

properties.name: stopPropagation
properties.description: Set this to true to stop the event propagation of the keypress event.

events.name: key
events.description: Fired when key was catched on target

elements.name: furo-navigation-pad
elements.description:
`furo-navigation-pad` listens to different keyboard navigation events like the arrow keys. It will attach the listeners
 to the parent node and cancel the default and stop the propagation of the events.

 The events are available as standalone events or as combined event in the `navigated` event.

 ```html
 <!-- forward all navigation events except the Escape  -->
 <furo-navigation-pad
     ignored-keys="Escape" at-navigated="--navpad"
     ></furo-navigation-pad>

 ```

attributes.name: ignored-keys
attributes.description:
Enter the keys you want to ignore as comma seperated values.

i.e. "Escape, ArrowLeft"

properties.name: ignoredKeys
properties.description:
Enter the keys you want to ignore as comma seperated values.

i.e. "Escape, ArrowLeft"

events.name: navigated
events.description: Generic navigation event, fired when one of the navigation keys was pressed, detail contains one of these: Escape | Enter | ArrowDown | ArrowUp |ArrowLeft|ArrowRight| PageUp | PageDown | Home | End

events.name: enter-pressed
events.description: Fired when Enter key was pressed.

events.name: arrow-down-pressed
events.description: Fired when ArrowDown key was pressed.

events.name: arrow-up-pressed
events.description: Fired when ArrowUp key was pressed.

events.name: arrow-left-pressed
events.description: Fired when ArrowLeft key was pressed.

events.name: arrow-right-pressed
events.description: Fired when ArrowRight key was pressed.

events.name: escape-pressed
events.description: Fired when Escape key was pressed.

events.name: page-up-pressed
events.description: Fired when PageUp key was pressed.

events.name: page-down-pressed
events.description: Fired when PageDown key was pressed.

events.name: home-pressed
events.description: Fired when Home key was pressed.

events.name: end-pressed
events.description: Fired when End key was pressed.

elements.name: furo-put-clipboard
elements.description:
`furo-put-clipboard`
 put content to the clipboard of the OS.

```html

<furo-put-clipboard
    json
    fn-trigger="--data" at-content-put="--contentInClipboard"
    ></furo-put-clipboard>

```

attributes.description: Stringify JSON content. Set this to true to auto stringify your JSON object with a 2 indention.

methods.description: Set data that you want to put to clipboard.

methods.name: trigger
methods.description:
Write data to the clipboard

If you trigger without data, the data which sas set with `setData` will be written to the clipboard.

events.name: content-put
events.description: Fired when content is written to clipboard
